headline: AppLovin Stock Keeps on Climbing. Why It Still Has Room to Rise.
summary: AppLovin stock has been on a tear over the last year, and the mobile technology company isn’t slowing down any time soon, analysts say.  The company, which provides monetization tools to mobile app developers, scored two price-target boosts from Wall Street on Thursday ahead of the soft launch of its self-serve Axon Ads Manager platform next month.  AppLovin  shares were up 2.8% to $658.08 on Friday.

raw.headline: AppLovin Stock Keeps on Climbing. Why It Still Has Room to Rise.

AppLovin  shares were up 2.8% to $658.08 on Friday.

headline: Akido Labs Uses Meta's Llama And Anthropic's Claude To Diagnose Patients As AI System ScopeAI Promises Faster Medicaid Care
summary: Patients in Southern California are receiving diagnoses and treatment plans generated by artificial intelligence through Akido Labs' ScopeAI proprietary system, according to MIT. The startup uses large language models to transcribe conversations between patients and medical assistants, suggest potential diagnoses, and propose treatment steps that physicians later review and approve. headline: TikTok deal, NATO-Russia tensions, Meta-Google talks: 3 Things
summary: President Trump signed an executive order declaring his plan to sell Tiktok's US operations to new owners is getting a green light. NATO allies privately tell Russia that they are ready to shoot down its jets if they keep breaching air space. And Meta (META) and Google (GOOG), direct competitors in the ads business, are in talks for a potential partnership - according to the Information. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Instagram and Facebook to offer ad-free subscription option for UK users
summary: Investing.com -- Meta Platforms will soon give UK users the option to subscribe to Facebook and Instagram to avoid seeing ads, as part of a response to UK regulatory guidance, the company announced on Friday.

raw.headline: Instagram and Facebook to offer ad-free subscription option for UK users
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Meta Platforms will soon give UK users the option to subscribe to Facebook and Instagram to avoid seeing ads, as part of a response to UK regulatory guidance, the company announced on Friday.

headline: Meta to launch ad-free Facebook and Instagram subscriptions in UK
summary: The move will give users a choice between paying a monthly fee or continuing to use the services for free with targeted advertising, a model that has faced increasing scrutiny from European regulators.  The subscriptions, priced at 2.99 pounds ($3.99) a month on the web and 3.99 pounds on iOS and Android, reflect similar offerings Meta has rolled out in the European Union to comply with data privacy rules.  Meta said the ad-free tier was designed to give people more control over their online experience while preserving the company's ability to provide free services funded by ads.

headline: Meta, Volvo and Writers at Work Lead the Conversation on WhatsApp with Omnichat
summary: Omnichat, a leading omnichannel AI customer experience platform, recently hosted its Commerce Leadership Forum 2025 Series at the Meta Singapore and Meta Malaysia offices. The forums gathered industry leaders from Meta, Volvo Car Malaysia, and Writers At Work to discuss the transformative role of AI, data-driven insights, and the WhatsApp Business Platform in reshaping customer engagement.
